<h2 class="hidden"><span class="mw-headline" id="Steps">Steps</span></h2>
<a class="anchor" name="Choosing_a_Tank.2C_Fish.2C_and_Extra_Features_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky steps_first">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>1</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Choosing_a_Tank.2C_Fish.2C_and_Extra_Features">Choosing a Tank, Fish, and Extra Features</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_1">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-1-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-1-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/60/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-1-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_8c234860ff" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_8c234860ff')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/60/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-1-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript>
<script>WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');</script></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Decide what fish you want before buying your tank.</b> You won’t buy your fish until your tank is fully set up, but choosing your fish beforehand ensures that you buy the right tank size and accessories. You’ll also decide how many fish you want, whether you want coral or not, and what special parameters you’ll need to set up.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 1" class="reference" id="_ref-1"><a href="#_note-1">[1]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Saltwater aquariums can get expensive, so choosing your tank inhabitants beforehand will prevent you from wasting money on an incorrect tank or features.</li>
</ul>
<script>WH.performance.mark('step1_rendered');</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-2-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-2-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/50/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-2-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_0a6fc70dd2" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_0a6fc70dd2')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/50/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-2-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Choose fish that are hardy and peaceful if you’re a beginner.</b> When you’re just starting, it’s best to choose fish that are tolerant of a fluctuating environment, resistant to parasites, and non-aggressive. You’ll also want fish that are vibrant and fun to look at—and within your budget! You can ask the employees at your local pet store for recommendations. Some species to consider include:<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 2" class="reference" id="_ref-2"><a href="#_note-2">[2]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Clownfish</li>
<li>Cardinalfish</li>
<li>Firefish</li>
<li>Royal Grammas</li>
<li>Swissguard Basslets</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-3-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-3-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9e/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-3-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_e387756c5a" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_e387756c5a')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9e/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-3-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Avoid common saltwater fish that are too sensitive or aggressive.</b> Some species of saltwater fish are often recommended for beginner tanks, but you should purchase them with care. Avoid any fish that are picky eaters, classified as aggressive or semi-aggressive, or are sensitive to environment fluctuation. Fish to avoid include:<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 3" class="reference" id="_ref-3"><a href="#_note-3">[3]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Mandarinfish, which are picky eaters</li>
<li>Bluestreak Cleaner Wrasse, which are picky eaters</li>
<li>Groupers, which are very aggressive</li>
<li>Damselfish, which are aggressive and territorial</li>
<li>Mollies and guppies</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-4-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-4-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/27/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-4-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_85932864cf" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_85932864cf')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/27/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-4-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Choose a short, wide tank.</b> Tanks that are short and wide, as opposed to tall, allow good oxygen flow within the water, better light penetration, and easier cleaning. Your fish will enjoy the extra horizontal swimming space, and you can get more creative with your aquascaping to give them more nooks and niches to explore.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 4" class="reference" id="_ref-4"><a href="#_note-4">[4]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>If you have to go with a tall, narrow tank for space reasons, use powerful circulation tools to move water throughout the tank and encourage oxygenation.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-5-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-5-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/dc/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-5-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_85816a2f89" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_85816a2f89')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/dc/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-5-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Buy a tank large enough for your fully-grown fish.</b> Look online to figure out how large your fish species will grow in captivity. Then, add up the length and width measurements of your tank and divide them by the fish’s size. The answer should be greater than 4, but larger than 6 is preferable.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 5" class="reference" id="_ref-5"><a href="#_note-5">[5]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>For example, if your fish grows to be 21 inches (53 cm) in captivity and your tank is 3 by 6 feet (0.91 by 1.83 m) long, you’d divide 108 inches (270 cm) by 21 inches (53 cm) to get 5.1. This tank would be big enough.</li>
<li>As a rule of thumb for how many fish your saltwater aquarium can hold, estimate that you can have 3 inches (7.6 cm) of fish for every square foot (0.3 m) of surface area.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-6-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-6-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2a/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-6-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_a3d63c4fb2" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_a3d63c4fb2')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2a/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-6-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Go for a bigger tank when you’re in doubt.</b> A larger tank gives you a greater margin of error in case you make a mistake—there will be more water to dilute possible pollutants, for example. You’ll also have fewer fish interaction problems and a more stable overall system.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 6" class="reference" id="_ref-6"><a href="#_note-6">[6]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>You’ll have room for more aquascaping as well, with additions like rocks and plants.</li>
<li>Many aquarium owners who start off with a small tank will soon upgrade to a larger one, resulting in more set-up work and financial investment.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-7-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-7-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cf/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-7-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_ee435bd12d" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_ee435bd12d')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cf/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-7-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Buy a submersible heater of 3-5 watts per gallon.</b> This should be a minimum size—for a larger tank, you may want a bigger heater. When you place it in the tank, you’ll want to keep the water at 72 to 82 °F (22 to 28 °C), depending on your fish.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 7" class="reference" id="_ref-7"><a href="#_note-7">[7]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Saltwater fish are very sensitive to temperature change, so it’s important to keep your tank’s water at a constant temperature.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-8-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-8-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cf/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-8-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_636b766bc8" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_636b766bc8')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cf/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-8-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 8" class="step_num">8</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_8"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Purchase a filter to keep your water clean.</b> Look for a filtration system made for saltwater aquariums. Ask a salesperson what size you should get for your chosen tank, and purchase in a store or online for convenience.

<ul>
<li>Don’t set up your filter just yet. You’ll install it once you’ve filled your tank.</li>
<li>Filters can also be called powerheads.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-9-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-9-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/68/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-9-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_efaa3e76e0" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_efaa3e76e0')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/68/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-9-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 9" class="step_num">9</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_9"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Choose aquarium lighting that’s suitable for your saltwater fish.</b> Buy an aquarium lighting system in a pet store or online and set it to illuminate your aquarium for 8-10 hours a day. Look up what light spectrum you’ll need for your desired fish, or ask a pet store employee for a recommendation.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 8" class="reference" id="_ref-8"><a href="#_note-8">[8]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Many aquarium lights come with built in timers to turn on and off automatically.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="methodad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-apsload="1" data-channels="6381149051,3492389196" data-lateload="0" data-loaded="0" data-service="dfp" data-slot="" data-viewablerefresh="1">
<div id="methodad"></div>
<script>googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('methodad'); });</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addBodyAd('methodad')</script>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Setting_Up_Your_Saltwater_Tank_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>2</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Setting_Up_Your_Saltwater_Tank">Setting Up Your Saltwater Tank</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_2">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-10.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-10.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/28/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-10.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-10.jpg" height="546" id="img_e91b85576b" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_e91b85576b')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/28/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-10.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-10.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Choose a large, level area to place your saltwater tank.</b> Find a smooth, firm, level surface to place your tank, such as a steady table. Look over the floor surface as well and make sure that your tank won’t wobble when you touch it or walk by.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 9" class="reference" id="_ref-9"><a href="#_note-9">[9]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Splashes of saltwater are bound to hit the surrounding floor and table, so place down towels or move important items out of the way.</li>
<li>Tank water will also evaporate a bit, driving up humidity in the surrounding area. Consider moving nearby furnishings or artwork so they’re not damaged.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-11.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-11.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6d/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-11.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-11.jpg" height="546" id="img_ec3ec1d6af" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_ec3ec1d6af')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6d/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-11.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-11.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Make sure your floor can bear the weight of your tank.</b> This is especially important if you live in an apartment or on the second story of a building. Try to set up your tank near a load-bearing wall, perpendicular to your floor joists.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 10" class="reference" id="_ref-10"><a href="#_note-10">[10]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Weigh your tank and tank stand and add about 8.5 pounds (3.9 kg) for every gallon of water that the tank holds to get the full weight of your aquarium system.</li>
<li>Ask your landlord, look at your housing plans, or consult a structural engineer if you’re not sure that your floor can bear the weight.</li>
<li>If necessary, you can reinforce the floor from underneath to prevent sagging and cracking.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-12.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-12.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/51/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-12.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-12.jpg" height="546" id="img_56f9b67e92" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_56f9b67e92')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/51/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-12.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-12.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Set your tank near an outlet.</b> You’ll need to plug in your tank’s lights, heater and filter. If possible, you may also want to keep your tank near a sink and drain in case you have to quickly fill or empty your tank.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 11" class="reference" id="_ref-11"><a href="#_note-11">[11]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>If you don’t have enough wall outlets for your equipment, you can use a power strip.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-13.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-13.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0a/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-13.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-13.jpg" height="546" id="img_9bce617572" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_9bce617572')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0a/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-13.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-13.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Keep your tank away from heat sources.</b> Make sure your aquarium is out of direct sunlight and away from air conditioners, heat vents, and doors to the outside. These can make the water temperature fluctuate and lead to algae issues on your tank walls.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 12" class="reference" id="_ref-12"><a href="#_note-12">[12]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-14.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-14.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b3/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-14.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-14.jpg" height="546" id="img_bc79b1f94d" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_bc79b1f94d')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b3/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-14.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-14.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Set the tank at least 5 inches (13 cm) away from the wall.</b> You’ll need to attach external features, such as a filter and protein skimmer, to the back of your aquarium. Leave some open space behind it to accommodate.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 13" class="reference" id="_ref-13"><a href="#_note-13">[13]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Some features may also be attached below the tank and under the tank stand. Check the directions beforehand to see where to place yours.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
<div id="tocad_wrap">
<div class="wh_ad_inner step_ad" data-adsenseheight="90" data-adsensewidth="728" data-adtargetid="tocad" data-adunitpath="" data-aps-timeout="2000" data-channels="6381149051,3492389196" data-lateload="1" data-loaded="0" data-service="adsense" data-slot="3356467874" data-viewablerefresh="1" id="tocad_outer"><div class="step_ad" id="tocad"></div></div>
<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addTOCAd('tocad')</script>
</div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Adding_Saltwater_and_Substrate_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>3</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Adding_Saltwater_and_Substrate">Adding Saltwater and Substrate</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_3">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-15.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-15.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 15" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3d/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-15.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-15.jpg" height="546" id="img_b43f8ea2e6" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_b43f8ea2e6')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 15" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3d/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-15.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-15.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Clean your empty tank with a cloth and freshwater before you add anything.</b> Dip a clean cloth in warm freshwater and scrub it over the inside of the tank. This will remove any dust or dirt that has seeped into the tank while on display or at the manufacturer.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 14" class="reference" id="_ref-14"><a href="#_note-14">[14]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Don’t use chemical cleaners on your aquarium. They can leach into your water and harm your fish.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-16.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-16.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 16" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4b/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-16.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-16.jpg" height="546" id="img_6a9c2ca967" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_6a9c2ca967')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 16" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4b/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-16.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-16.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Pour in 2–3 inches (5.1–7.6 cm) of live sand.</b> Live sand has bacteria and tiny invertebrates in it, which help to naturally filter water and make the aquarium a more hospitable environment for your fish. Live sand also looks just like regular sand, adding a natural look to your aquarium.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 15" class="reference" id="_ref-15"><a href="#_note-15">[15]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>You can buy live sand online or at your local pet store.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-17.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-17.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 17" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bf/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-17.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-17.jpg" height="546" id="img_a7db5b79aa" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_a7db5b79aa')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 17" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bf/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-17.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-17.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Use pre-mixed saltwater for a simpler set-up process.</b> You can buy pre-mixed saltwater mixtures online or in most large pet stores. These solutions are ready to be poured straight into your aquarium, with no other mixing and prepping required.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 16" class="reference" id="_ref-16"><a href="#_note-16">[16]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Make sure to read the directions before you use the saltwater.</li>
<li>Check your tank’s volume and buy enough saltwater to fill it up completely.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-18.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-18.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 18" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/16/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-18.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-18.jpg" height="546" id="img_d4a4266d42" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_d4a4266d42')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 18" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/16/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-18.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-18.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Create saltwater with a synthetic sea salt mix for a cheaper set-up.</b> Most saltwater aquarium owners choose to make their own saltwater by adding a mix to filtered tap water. You can buy saltwater aquarium mix online or in pet stores for a cheap price, and save it to use again when you need to replenish your tank.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 17" class="reference" id="_ref-17"><a href="#_note-17">[17]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Consult the directions before you start setting up your tank to make sure you don’t have to take extra steps for your brand.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-19.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-19.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 19" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8e/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-19.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-19.jpg" height="546" id="img_9b08603016" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_9b08603016')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 19" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8e/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-19.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-19.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Fill the tank a third of the way and check for leaks.</b> Run your hands along the outside edges of the tank and look carefully at the area around it. If you don’t see or feel any water, you can continue filling up the tank slowly.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 18" class="reference" id="_ref-18"><a href="#_note-18">[18]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Set a small bowl in the tank and pour the water directly into it, instead of onto the sand, to keep your sand in place.</li>
<li>You may want to pour in sink water from a bucket, rather than holding your tank under the sink or filling with a hose.</li>
<li>If you do feel a leak, dump out the sand and water and return the tank.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-20.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-20.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 20" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4f/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-20.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-20.jpg" height="546" id="img_e01a5ab502" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_e01a5ab502')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 20" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4f/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-20.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-20.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Pour in a water conditioner to filter out metals and chlorine.</b> Water conditioner is a specially formulated liquid designed to remove heavy metals, chlorine, and/or chloramine from your sink water, making it safe for your fish. You can add the conditioner after you’ve poured your water into the tank. If you’re using a bucket, mix it there beforehand.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 19" class="reference" id="_ref-19"><a href="#_note-19">[19]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Read the package instructions before you use your conditioner.</li>
<li>Buy a water conditioner at a pet store, or search for one to buy online.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-21.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-21.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 21" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/86/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-21.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-21.jpg" height="546" id="img_92d53210cd" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_92d53210cd')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 21" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/86/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-21.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-21.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Add small amounts of salt mix until you get to the right specific gravity.</b> Check the directions on your packet for a salt mix per gallon specification. Start stirring in your salt mix bit by bit. Use a hydrometer or refractometer to measure your tank’s specific gravity, which is an indirect measurement of its saltiness.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 20" class="reference" id="_ref-20"><a href="#_note-20">[20]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>For a fish-only tank, you should aim for a specific gravity level of 1.017-1.021.</li>
<li>Hydrometers are small, plastic measuring devices that you can buy online or in a pet store. To use, dip the hydrometer in the tank for a water sample and take a reading from the marker.</li>
<li>If your specific gravity is too low, add a bit more salt. If it’s too high, dump out a bit of water and replace it with filtered fresh water.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-22.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-22.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 22" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f6/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-22.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-22.jpg" height="546" id="img_2ffb1454b2" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_2ffb1454b2')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 22" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f6/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-22.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-22.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 8" class="step_num">8</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_8"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Place your powerhead filter and heater in to start circulation.</b> Once you’ve reached the right specific gravity, follow the directions on your powerhead, or filter, to place it on the side of the tank. Slip your submersible heater in as well. Plug in both devices to start circulation and heating.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 21" class="reference" id="_ref-21"><a href="#_note-21">[21]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>If possible, place the powerhead so that it makes a bit of turbulence on the water’s surface. This encourages the best possible gas exchange.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-23.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-23.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 23" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/54/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-23.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-23.jpg" height="546" id="img_00cbe104ee" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_00cbe104ee')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 23" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/54/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-23.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-23.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 9" class="step_num">9</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_9"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Let the saltwater circulate and heat for 24-48 hours.</b> Your water is almost ready! Let the tank sit for 1-2 days, giving the salt time to dissolve and letting heater get the tank to your desired temperature. After a day or so, test the specific gravity again to make sure it’s still at the right level.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 22" class="reference" id="_ref-22"><a href="#_note-22">[22]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Add more salt mix or freshwater to adjust the specific gravity.</li>
<li>Check the temperature as well, turning the heater up or down as needed.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-24.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-24.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 24" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-24.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-24.jpg" height="546" id="img_a2a9b2e021" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_a2a9b2e021')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 24" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-24.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-24.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 10" class="step_num">10</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_10"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Add cured live rock to “cycle” the tank.</b> Place 1.5 pounds (0.68 kg) of cured live rock into your tank for every gallon (3.8 L) of water. This kind of rock is the best natural way to “cycle” your aquarium, or create a bio-filtration system. Cured live rocks introduce good bacteria to convert ammonia, which will be produced by your fishes’ waste and respiration, into less harmful compounds.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 23" class="reference" id="_ref-23"><a href="#_note-23">[23]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Look for cured live rock online and in pet stores.</li>
<li>The rocks also function as an ammonia source for bacteria to work on. Their porous surfaces, meanwhile, give this bacteria a great home to grow in.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-25.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-25.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 25" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a7/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-25.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-25.jpg" height="546" id="img_e311cde516" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_e311cde516')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 25" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a7/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-25.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-25.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 11" class="step_num">11</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_11"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Test your aquarium’s ammonia, nitrite, and nitrate levels with test kits.</b> While your aquarium is cycling with the cured live rock, all you need to do is keep an eye on its progress with ammonia, nitrite, and nitrate test kits. Test your tank at least once a day.Your tank is done cycling when nitrate is present and the ammonia and nitrate levels are too small to be measured.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 24" class="reference" id="_ref-24"><a href="#_note-24">[24]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Buy good test kits online or in home improvement stores.</li>
<li>Throughout the course of the cycle, you’ll see the ammonia and nitrite levels increase and then drop down, along with an increase in nitrates.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-26.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-26.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 26" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f0/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-26.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-26.jpg" height="546" id="img_f51788abbf" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_f51788abbf')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 26" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f0/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-26.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-26.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 12" class="step_num">12</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_12"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Add saltwater rocks and features to decorate your tank.</b> If you want to decorate your tank any more, now is the time! Place rocks, fake plants, or any other features that you want to add. Make sure they’re safe for saltwater environments.

<ul>
<li>Clean off any new features with a clean cloth and warm freshwater beforehand.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Buying_and_Acclimatizing_Your_Fish_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>4</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Buying_and_Acclimatizing_Your_Fish">Buying and Acclimatizing Your Fish</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_4">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-27.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-27.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 27" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/95/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-27.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-27.jpg" height="546" id="img_2822908cb3" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_2822908cb3')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 27" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/95/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-27.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-27.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Purchase your fish in-store so you can check their health.</b> If you buy in-person, make sure your fish and its tankmates are healthy—if its tankmates are sick, there’s a good chance your fish will be too. Ask the salesperson to feed the fish and make sure it responds normally to the food. Some physical and behavioral issues to look out for include:<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 25" class="reference" id="_ref-25"><a href="#_note-25">[25]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Very damaged, missing, or clamped fins</li>
<li>Cloudy or bulging eyes</li>
<li>Visible injuries or ulcers on the body</li>
<li>Mucus</li>
<li>An emaciated or bloated body</li>
<li>Faded coloration</li>
<li>Twitching or trembling</li>
<li>Erratic swimming or hitting objects in the tank</li>
<li>Rapid respiration</li>
<li>Behavior that’s out of character for the species, like a typically shy species seeming outgoing</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-28.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-28.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 28" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/ba/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-28.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-28.jpg" height="546" id="img_e00ae4326e" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_e00ae4326e')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 28" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/ba/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-28.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-28.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Buy your saltwater fish online for convenience and a greater selection.</b> If you don’t have a good fish store near you, buying your fish online might be your best option. Make sure to only purchase from reputable sites. Look at their shipping specifications and check for customer reviews and verifications to ensure it’s a good site.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 26" class="reference" id="_ref-26"><a href="#_note-26">[26]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>One of the main drawbacks of buying online is that you can’t see the fish in-person beforehand. If possible, ask to see the fish via photo or video call to judge its condition.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-29.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-29.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 29" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3a/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-29.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-29.jpg" height="546" id="img_cf97cfd290" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_cf97cfd290')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 29" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3a/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-29.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-29.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Set a clear container below the tank to be the “acclimation container.</b>” Once you’ve bought your fish, it’s time to acclimatize it and transfer it to the tank! Place a clean, clear container below your tank, such as on the ground or a lower table. The container should be large enough to hold your fish comfortably.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 27" class="reference" id="_ref-27"><a href="#_note-27">[27]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Acclimatizing is the process of getting your fish used to its new environment, including a new water pH and temperature.</li>
<li>If you’ve bought a few fish, it’s best to add them one at a time, starting with the least aggressive.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-30.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-30.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 30" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ab/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-30.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-30.jpg" height="546" id="img_609384053b" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_609384053b')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 30" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ab/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-30.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-30.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Place airline tubing between the acclimation container and tank.</b> Stretch a several feet of flexible airline tubing between the tank and the acclimation container. Tie 2-3 loose knots along the tubing and place the tank end 5 to 6 inches (13 to 15 cm) below the water’s surface.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 28" class="reference" id="_ref-28"><a href="#_note-28">[28]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Wedge the tubing between the rim and cover to keep it in place.</li>
<li>You can buy airline tubing at home improvement stores and online.</li>
<li>If you have a flow-control valve or clamp to fit your tubing, you can attach it to the acclimation-container end of the tubing. If you use a valve, you don’t have to tie knots in the tubing.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-31.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-31.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 31" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a3/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-31.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-31.jpg" height="546" id="img_63243c592b" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_63243c592b')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 31" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a3/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-31.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-31.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Pour the fish and water into the container and start the water flow.</b> Place the tank end of your tubing into the output end of your powerhead. Tighten or loosen your knots as needed to bring the flow down, so that 2-3 drips per second are falling into the acclimation container.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 29" class="reference" id="_ref-29"><a href="#_note-29">[29]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>You can also adjust the flow by using your flow-control valve.</li>
<li>Don’t pour extra freshwater or saltwater into the acclimation container. Pour the fish in with just its shipping water.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-32.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-32.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 32" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/91/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-32.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-32.jpg" height="546" id="img_a81bc7abd6" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_a81bc7abd6')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 32" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/91/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-32.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-32.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Drape a towel over the acclimation container to keep the fish calm.</b> The fish will probably be nervous and scared, and may even try to jump out of the container. Draping a towel or cloth over the container will lessen the stimulation and give it time to get used to its new surroundings.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 30" class="reference" id="_ref-30"><a href="#_note-30">[30]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-33.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-33.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 33" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/47/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-33.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-33.jpg" height="546" id="img_4c642b22da" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_4c642b22da')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 33" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/47/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-33.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-33.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Let the water drip until there’s twice as much water in the container.</b> Keep an eye on the water in the acclimation container. Once it’s doubled in volume, use a clean bowl or turkey baster to remove about half of the water. Put the tubing back in place and start the dripping once more.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 31" class="reference" id="_ref-31"><a href="#_note-31">[31]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Depending on how big your acclimation container is, this might take an hour or more. Be patient—proper acclimation is essential to the health of your new fish.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-34.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-34.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 34" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/63/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-34.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-34.jpg" height="546" id="img_615aba109f" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_615aba109f')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 34" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/63/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-34.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-34.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 8" class="step_num">8</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_8"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Test the water once it’s doubled again.</b> Once your water level is back up, use test kits to check the amount of ammonia, nitrite, nitrate, pH, specific gravity, and temperature in the acclimation container’s water. If they’re identical to the aquarium’s water parameters, it’s time to transfer your fish!<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 32" class="reference" id="_ref-32"><a href="#_note-32">[32]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>If the acclimation container’s water parameters don’t match the aquarium’s, continue your cycle of dripping, removing water, and testing until they do.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-35.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-35.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 35" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/84/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-35.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-35.jpg" height="546" id="img_6f868012a2" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_6f868012a2')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 35" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/84/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-35.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-35.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 9" class="step_num">9</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_4_9"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Move the fish into the tank with a net.</b> Carefully scoop up your fish with a clean fish net and slide it into your aquarium. You can also pour the fish into the tank with its water, especially if your aquarium water needs to be replenished after dripping through the tube.

</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Taking_Care_of_Your_Saltwater_Aquarium_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock">Part <span>5</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Taking_Care_of_Your_Saltwater_Aquarium">Taking Care of Your Saltwater Aquarium</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_5">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-36.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-36.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 36" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/ff/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-36.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-36.jpg" height="546" id="img_3b398b4750" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_3b398b4750')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 36" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/ff/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-36.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-36.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Feed your fish the appropriate food several times a day.</b> Do some research into what kinds of food you should feed your fish—some may be fine with a mix of pellets, while others might prefer fresh food from a seafood market. Try to feed them several small servings a day rather than 1-2 large feedings, as this keeps them more satisfied.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 33" class="reference" id="_ref-33"><a href="#_note-33">[33]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Buy food at your pet store or at seafood markets. Make sure any non-pellet food you give your fish are from saltwater habitats, not freshwater.</li>
<li>Watch your fish when they feed. They should eat quickly and finish every bite! If you see a fish not eating, talk to your veterinarian.</li>
<li>Give your fish a different kind of food every few days to ensure they’re getting the right nutrients and staying satisfied.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-37.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-37.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 37" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-37.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-37.jpg" height="546" id="img_eb2b046f1e" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_eb2b046f1e')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 37" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-37.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-37.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Set up a protein skimmer and empty its collection cup every day.</b> A protein skimmer collects dissolved organic compounds, like waste, filtering them out of the water to keep it clean and clear. Set yours up according to the package instructions and empty it daily to keep it working well.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 34" class="reference" id="_ref-34"><a href="#_note-34">[34]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>To empty the protein skimmer, simply remove the collection cup, empty it in the sink, and rinse it clean.</li>
<li>You can buy a protein skimmer wherever fish aquarium products are sold, in pet stores, and online.</li>
<li>Protein skimmers can attach below the tank, on the rim, or inside the tank.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-38.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-38.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 38" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d7/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-38.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-38.jpg" height="546" id="img_0cfa77e586" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_0cfa77e586')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 38" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d7/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-38.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-38.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Replenish evaporated saltwater with purified freshwater every day.</b> Although water will eventually evaporate from your aquarium, the salt will be left behind. To return your water level to normal, simply add purified freshwater to the tank.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 35" class="reference" id="_ref-35"><a href="#_note-35">[35]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Don’t add new saltwater after evaporation. This will alter the specific gravity of your system.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-39.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-39.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 39" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0e/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-39.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-39.jpg" height="546" id="img_3c6e3ba090" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_3c6e3ba090')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 39" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0e/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-39.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-39.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Clean the algae off the tank every day.</b> Use an algae magnet, brush, or scraper to clean the algae film off of your aquarium glass every day. If the algae builds up at a slower rate, you can switch to every other day, or even weekly.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 36" class="reference" id="_ref-36"><a href="#_note-36">[36]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-40.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-40.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 40" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3c/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-40.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-40.jpg" height="546" id="img_12644d734f" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_12644d734f')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 40" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3c/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-40.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-40.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Test water parameters, change water, and do deeper cleaning weekly.</b> Along with a few quick everyday tasks, there are a few things you can do on a weekly or bi-weekly basis to keep your tank clean and pleasant for your fish. These include:<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 37" class="reference" id="_ref-37"><a href="#_note-37">[37]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Testing the specific gravity, pH, ammonia, nitrite, nitrate, and alkalinity of the water.</li>
<li>Clean the salt off your aquarium cover, power cords, and the edges of the tank.</li>
<li>Mix up new saltwater and change about 10% of the aquarium water.</li>
<li>Clean the neck of your protein skimmer.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-41.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-41.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 41" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5c/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-41.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-41.jpg" height="546" id="img_1f8c15846e" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_1f8c15846e')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 41" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5c/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-41.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-41.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 6" class="step_num">6</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_6"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Wash tank parts every month or two.</b> Do a more thorough cleaning of the important features in your tank every month or so. Incorporate these tasks into your monthly routine:<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 38" class="reference" id="_ref-38"><a href="#_note-38">[38]</a></sup>
<ul>
<li>Dampen a paper towel with white vinegar to clean calcium deposits from your tank cover and light fixture cover.</li>
<li>Take apart your protein skimmer and carefully clean all its parts.</li>
<li>Soak your powerhead, heater, and any other submerged features in a 1:1 solution of water and white vinegar.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage final_li">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-42.jpg?ajax=true&aid=1352093" href="#/Image:Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-42.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 42" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-42.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-42.jpg" height="546" id="img_cfcc7ff4ac" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_cfcc7ff4ac')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Start a Saltwater Aquarium Step 42" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-42.jpg/aid1352093-v4-728px-Start-a-Saltwater-Aquarium-Step-42.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 7" class="step_num">7</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_5_7"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Replace the bulbs in your lighting according to package instructions.</b> Check the manual to your lighting system to see when it’s recommended to change your bulbs. If you have LED bulbs, you likely won’t have to change them for at least a few years.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 39" class="reference" id="_ref-39"><a href="#_note-39">[39]</a></sup>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Questions_and_Answers_sub"></a>
<div class="qa section sticky qa_show_unanswered_questions" data-aid="1352093" data-few_contribs="1" data-search_enabled="0">
<h2>
<div class="altblock"></div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="qa_headline">Community Q&A</span>
</h2>
<div class="section_text" id="qa">
<div id="qa_answered_questions_container">
<div id="qa_aq_search_container">
<div class="qa_section_heading" id="qa_aq_search_heading">Search</div>
<input class="qa_aq_search" placeholder="Type your query here"/>
</div>
<a id="qa_add_curated_question">Add New Question</a>
<ul class="qa_questions qa_aqs qa_waittheresmore" id="qa_article_questions">
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="109100" data-caid="109973" data-cqid="109117" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="507920" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="5" data-votes_up="22">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">How many fish are allowable for a 20 gallon tank and how many live corals can be put into it?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Some would say two, but to be honest, you can put as many fish as you want, as long as your bio-load isn't too much for your filtration. A good rule of thumb is to have 1 pound live rock per gallon of water. Corrals are alive to and can produce waste but can also get ride of toxins.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_links">
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">Yes</a>
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>
<div class="qa_widget_vote_buttons">
<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>5</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>22</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="81752" data-caid="82625" data-cqid="81769" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="635880" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="9" data-votes_up="32">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Can I use a 20-gallon tank?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">A 20-gallon tank is the minimum tank size for a reef or saltwater tank. Although it may be harder to maintain than a bigger tank, it is possible to create a saltwater tank using 20 gallons. Be mindful of the fish stocking to ensure that too many fish do not over-pollute the system.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">
<span class="wh_thumb_response wh_thumb_msg">Thanks!</span>

<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box button secondary" href="#">No</a>
</div>

<a class="wh_vote_down wh_vote_box" href="#">Not Helpful <span>9</span></a>
<a class="wh_vote_up wh_vote_box" href="#">Helpful <span>32</span></a>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="84492" data-caid="85365" data-cqid="84509" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="606621" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="12" data-votes_up="26">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Can I put actual crabs, eels, and starfish in a home saltwater fish tank?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Crabs and starfish should be fine. I've heard of starfish eating crabs so be careful of the size of the starfish. As for eels, I wouldn't. But that doesn't mean you can't.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="163511" data-caid="164384" data-cqid="163528" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="1075978" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="3" data-votes_up="10">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">Can I use a 10 gallon tank for a saltwater aquarium?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Yes, but it is much more difficult. The smaller the tank is, the more unstable the system is. Ph, salinity, and temperature can all fluctuate very quickly in a smaller tank, so managing one is not a task suited for beginners.</div>

</div>
